question.title: How to replace FLAG_FULLSCREEN with WindowInsetsController and hide
question.body:
My old way of making my app fullscreen was using the following in onCreate of the MainActivity:

getWindow().setFlags(WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_FULLSCREEN, WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_FULLSCREEN);

But they are saying that is depracated.

This page says I need to use WindowInsetsController.hide(int) with Type.statusBars() instead.

Does anyone know how with some code? Especially, making it backwardly compatible with pre API 30?

answers.body:
You can try this, support all versions

if (Build.VERSION.SDK_INT >= Build.VERSION_CODES.R) {
    final WindowInsetsController insetsController = getWindow().getInsetsController();
    if (insetsController != null) {
        insetsController.hide(WindowInsets.Type.statusBars() |                       WindowInsets.Type.navigationBars());
        insetsController.setSystemBarsBehavior(WindowInsetsController.BEHAVIOR_SHOW_TRANSIENT_BARS_BY_SWIPE);
    }

} else {
    
    getWindow().setFlags(
        WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_FULLSCREEN,
        WindowManager.LayoutParams.FLAG_FULLSCREEN
    );
}
